main_definition: Individuals who participate in the voting process to elect representatives or make decisions on various issues.

meanings_and_examples.definition: People with a right to vote in an election
meanings_and_examples.example: The eligible voters were reminded of their civic duty.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Members of the electorate who cast their ballots in an election or referendum
meanings_and_examples.example: During the mayoral race, the turnout of voters was surprisingly high.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Participants in a primary election, caucus, or other preliminary voting event
meanings_and_examples.example: The young voters showed great enthusiasm at the local Democratic Caucus.
